examples: All plants need light and water.

food plants of rare butterflies

meanings.def: the large machines that are used in industrial processes
examples: The company has been investing in new plant and equipment.

meanings.def: something that somebody has deliberately placed among another person’s clothes or possessions in order to make them appear guilty of a crime
examples: He claimed that the drugs found in his house were a plant.

meanings.def: a person who joins a group of criminals or enemies in order to get and secretly report information about their activities
to put plants, seeds, etc. in the ground to grow
examples: to plant a tree/seed/crop
to plant and harvest rice
Plant the bulbs in pots for a spring display.
Carefully plant your cutting in the soil.
Zinfandel is California's most widely planted red grape.
recently planted maples
weeds that had not been deliberately planted
Plant these shrubs in full sun.

meanings.def: to cover or supply a garden, area of land, etc. with plants
examples: plant something The children are planting a garden next to the school.
They have planted five acres of vines.
a densely planted orange grove
be planted with something The field had been ploughed and planted with corn.
The garden was planted with roses and other shrubs.
The Bordeaux area is densely planted with vine.

meanings.def: to place something or yourself in a particular place or position
examples: They planted a flag on the summit.
He planted himself squarely in front of us.
She was determined to keep both feet firmly planted on dry land.
She planted a kiss squarely on his cheek.
Demonstrators planted themselves right in front of the convoy of trucks.

meanings.def: to hide something such as a bomb in a place where it will not be found
to hide something, especially something illegal, in somebody’s clothing, possessions, etc. so that when it is found it will look as though they committed a crime
examples: He claims that the drugs were planted on him.

meanings.def: to send somebody to join a group, etc., especially in order to make secret reports on its members
examples: The police had planted an informer in the gang.

meanings.def: to make somebody think or believe something, especially without them realizing that you gave them the idea
examples: He planted the first seeds of doubt in my mind.
